Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Improve the display package page's performance" (#7795) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
⚠ I need to test this on the PROD PERF environment to ensure there are no regressions.

These changes include:

1. The first SQL query for the display page gets the metadata for all versions of the package. This was an expensive query that also loaded the packages' deprecations. I've simplified this query.
1. I reduced the number of lazily loaded SQL queries.

Build: TODO
Release: TODO

Part of https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/2910

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[PackageType]Update Azure Search models to include [Filterable] package type" (#7753) at NuGet/NuGetGallery

Events.RelatedBody: Catalog2AzureSearch needs to be updated to insert the new packageTypes document field.

DB2AzureSearch needs to be updated to make the same document insertions that Catalog2AzureSearch will be making (see https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7702)

After the update is complete, a new index with the updated documents will need to be spun up to backfill the packagetype data.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support packageTypes property in catalog" (#7574) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
The [`packageTypes` nuspec property](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/nuspec#packagetypes) is used to distinguish between regular dependency packages, .NET CLI tools, and .NET CLI templates. Today, this property is always `""` on catalog leafs.

### To Reproduce

See the `packageTypes` property on the following catalog leafs:

* .NET CLI tool: https://api.nuget.org/v3/catalog0/data/2018.10.17.01.01.10/dotnet-xunit.2.4.0-beta.1.build3958.json
* .NET CLI template: https://api.nuget.org/v3/catalog0/data/2018.11.30.06.14.50/giraffe-template.0.1.0-alpha007.json

### Expected behavior
The catalog leaf should be a JSON array of all the package type names in the nuspec. For example:

```
"packageTypes": [
    "DotnetCliTool"
]
```

### Additional context
This is necessary to properly support package type filtering (see https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/5762). Today, the job mutating the search index must guess the package type from the catalog leafs' `packageEntries` property. This approach isn't ideal as the search index must be rebuilt when a new package type is introduced.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[PackageType]Add E2E test to push and then search by a DotnetTool package" (#7755) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Permission system does n+1 queries to fetch users' organizations" (#7794) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
This line performs n+1 SQL queriers, where n is the number of organizations the user is in:

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/90f8fbea00217db2e5d918e140621c0aea0ca12d/src/NuGetGallery.Services/Permissions/ActionRequiringEntityPermissions.cs#L79

For example, if I am a user in two organizations, the following SQL queries will be generated:

```sql
// Get my memberships
exec sp_executesql N'SELECT 
    [Extent1].[OrganizationKey] AS [OrganizationKey], 
    [Extent1].[MemberKey] AS [MemberKey], 
    [Extent1].[IsAdmin] AS [IsAdmin]
    FROM [dbo].[Memberships] AS [Extent1]
    WHERE [Extent1].[MemberKey] = @EntityKeyValue1',N'@EntityKeyValue1 int',@EntityKeyValue1=1

// Load the first organization
exec sp_executesql N'SELECT 
    ''0X0X'' AS [C1], 
    [Extent1].[Key] AS [Key], 
    [Extent2].[EmailAddress] AS [EmailAddress], 
    [Extent2].[UnconfirmedEmailAddress] AS [UnconfirmedEmailAddress], 
    [Extent2].[Username] AS [Username], 
    [Extent2].[EmailAllowed] AS [EmailAllowed], 
    [Extent2].[IsDeleted] AS [IsDeleted], 
    [Extent2].[EnableMultiFactorAuthentication] AS [EnableMultiFactorAuthentication], 
    [Extent2].[NotifyPackagePushed] AS [NotifyPackagePushed], 
    [Extent2].[EmailConfirmationToken] AS [EmailConfirmationToken], 
    [Extent2].[PasswordResetToken] AS [PasswordResetToken], 
    [Extent2].[PasswordResetTokenExpirationDate] AS [PasswordResetTokenExpirationDate], 
    [Extent2].[CreatedUtc] AS [CreatedUtc], 
    [Extent2].[LastFailedLoginUtc] AS [LastFailedLoginUtc], 
    [Extent2].[FailedLoginCount] AS [FailedLoginCount]
    FROM  [dbo].[Organizations] AS [Extent1]
    INNER JOIN [dbo].[Users] AS [Extent2] ON [Extent1].[Key] = [Extent2].[Key]
    WHERE [Extent1].[Key] = @EntityKeyValue1',N'@EntityKeyValue1 int',@EntityKeyValue1=3

//Load the second organization
exec sp_executesql N'SELECT 
    ''0X0X'' AS [C1], 
    [Extent1].[Key] AS [Key], 
    [Extent2].[EmailAddress] AS [EmailAddress], 
    [Extent2].[UnconfirmedEmailAddress] AS [UnconfirmedEmailAddress], 
    [Extent2].[Username] AS [Username], 
    [Extent2].[EmailAllowed] AS [EmailAllowed], 
    [Extent2].[IsDeleted] AS [IsDeleted], 
    [Extent2].[EnableMultiFactorAuthentication] AS [EnableMultiFactorAuthentication], 
    [Extent2].[NotifyPackagePushed] AS [NotifyPackagePushed], 
    [Extent2].[EmailConfirmationToken] AS [EmailConfirmationToken], 
    [Extent2].[PasswordResetToken] AS [PasswordResetToken], 
    [Extent2].[PasswordResetTokenExpirationDate] AS [PasswordResetTokenExpirationDate], 
    [Extent2].[CreatedUtc] AS [CreatedUtc], 
    [Extent2].[LastFailedLoginUtc] AS [LastFailedLoginUtc], 
    [Extent2].[FailedLoginCount] AS [FailedLoginCount]
    FROM  [dbo].[Organizations] AS [Extent1]
    INNER JOIN [dbo].[Users] AS [Extent2] ON [Extent1].[Key] = [Extent2].[Key]
    WHERE [Extent1].[Key] = @EntityKeyValue1',N'@EntityKeyValue1 int',@EntityKeyValue1=5
```

### Expected behavior
The user's organizations should be fetched with a single SQL query.

### Screenshots
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

### Additional context
Add any other context about the problem here.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Basic developer docs" (#8991) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
All of the how to work with NuGet docs should be public and on GitHub!

We should avoid the wiki for workflow related things and use the repo itself. 
It improves discoverability for contributors. It's in line with what the rest of the .NET repos do.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Baseline measurement around perf in 16.5p2" (#8989) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Publish Plan to address HaTS pain points" (#8988) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Investigate test parallelization for unit testing" (#8987) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We have many test suites that are not parallelized. 

We should strive for all of our unit tests to be parallelizable. 

This issue tracks that work.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "SpecCommand tests depend on the current year" (#8984) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
SpecCommand_NoProjectFile
SpecCommand_NoProjectFile_WithArg
SpecCommand_WithProjectFile

are failing with 

```
Assert.Equal() Failure\r\n ↓ (pos 611)\r\nExpected: ···pyright>Copyright 2019</copyright>\\n <tags>Tag1 Tag2</tags>···\r\nActual: ···pyright>Copyright 2020</copyright>\\n <tags>Tag1 Tag2</tags>···\r\n ↑ (pos 611)

```

Issue is: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/cb402b5a3340ab5b2605ecc72de7f70aaac95344/test/NuGet.Clients.Tests/NuGet.CommandLine.Test/NuGetSpecCommandTest.cs#L51

The fix is simple to just fix the tests to use the current year.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "In Visual Studio, the prompts for authentication do not contain any context about the reason (like feed url)" (#8986) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Reevaluate the frequency of prompts when a source can't be authenticated" (#8985) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We try for a max of 3 times per source when a source can't be authenticated. 

If you have many sources (and you don't have the rights), this could lead to getting 3 * sourceNumber prompts. 

As part of this work we should also ensure that the errors are clearly communicated to the user (given that the prompts are not owned by NuGet.
